name: Duckpool and steeples walk, North Cornwall

ai.summary: An easy, coastal 3.8 km hike along the North Cornwall coast from Duckpool to the Steeples, offering sea views, beach sections, and a gentle mix of paths and lanes.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly easy coastal terrain: flat or gently undulating paths, with sections on sand, gravel, and grassy lanes. Expect some exposed areas near viewpoints and possible mud after rain; surfaces can be slippery when wet, especially along the shoreline.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and sea conditions before you go; tides can affect beach sections. Stay on marked paths and away from cliff edges. Wear sturdy footwear and bring water, a light layer, and sun protection. Carry a map or offline navigation. If hiking with others, keep children or dogs under control and be mindful of other visitors.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or light hiking boots
Lightweight waterproof jacket and extra layer
Map, local guide, or offline navigation on a phone
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly April–October) for the most pleasant weather and beach conditions. The route is accessible year-round with proper clothing and awareness of coastal conditions.

seo.title: Duckpool and Steeples Walk – Easy 3.8 km Coastal Hike in North Cornwall, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover an easy 3.8 km coastal stroll from Duckpool to the Steeples in North Cornwall. Gentle terrain, sea views, best seasons, and practical safety tips for a short UK coastal hike.
seo.h1: Duckpool and Steeples Walk (North Cornwall) – Easy 3.8 km Coastal Hike
